name: Table
overview:
This class allows you interact with BigQuery.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/bigquery.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Table
methods.description: Table objects are returned by methods such as bigquery/dataset#table, bigquery/dataset#createTable, and bigquery/dataset#getTables.

examples.code:
var dataset = bigquery.dataset('my-dataset');

var table = dataset.table('my-table');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • See bigquery/dataset#createTable.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a table and all its data.

examples.code: table.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.code: table.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.exists
params.description: • Whether the table exists or not.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a table if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Return the metadata associated with the Table.

examples.code: table.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.metadata
params.description: • The metadata of the Table.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copy data from one table to another, optionally creating that table.

examples.caption: See the configuration.copy object for all available options.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: destination
params.description: • The destination table.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • Metadata to set with the copy operation. The metadata object should be in the format of the configuration.copy property of a Jobs resource.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.job
params.description: • The job used to copy your table.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

exceptions.description: If a destination other than a Table object is provided.

methods.name: copyFrom
methods.description: Copy data from multiple tables into this table.

examples.caption: See the configuration.copy object for all available options.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: sourceTables
params.description: • The source table(s) to copy data from.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • Metadata to set with the copy operation. The metadata object should be in the format of the configuration.copy property of a Jobs resource.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.job
params.description: • The job used to copy your table.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

exceptions.description: If a source other than a Table object is provided.

methods.name: createReadStream
methods.description: Create a readable stream of the rows of data in your table. This method is simply a wrapper around bigquery/table#getRows.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

methods.name: createWriteStream
methods.description: Load data into your table from a readable stream of JSON, CSV, or AVRO data.

examples.caption: Load data from a CSV file.
Load data from a JSON file.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • Metadata to set with the load operation. The metadata object should be in the format of the configuration.load property of a Jobs resource. If a string is given, it will be used as the filetype.

examples.caption: To use the default options, just pass a storage/file object. Note: The exported format type will be inferred by the file's extension. If you wish to override this, or provide an array of destination files, you must provide an options object.
If you need more customization, pass an options object.
You can also specify multiple destination files.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: destination
params.description: • Where the file should be exported to.

params.name: options
params.description: • The configuration object.

params.name: options.format
params.description: • The format to export the data in. Allowed options are "CSV", "JSON", or "AVRO". Default: "CSV".

params.name: options.gzip
params.description: • Specify if you would like the file compressed with GZIP. Default: false.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.job
params.description: • The job used to export the table.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

methods.name: getRows
methods.description: Retrieves table data from a specified set of rows. The rows are returned to your callback as an array of objects matching your table's schema.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • The configuration object.

params.name: options.autoPaginate
params.description: • Have pagination handled automatically. Default: true.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.rows
params.description: • The table data from specified set of rows.

methods.name: import
methods.description:
Load data from a local file or Storage file (storage/file).

By loading data this way, you create a load job that will run your data load asynchronously. If you would like instantaneous access to your data, insert it using bigquery/table#insert.

Note: The file type will be inferred by the given file's extension. If you wish to override this, you must provide metadata.format.

examples.caption: Load data from a local file.
You may also pass in metadata in the format of a Jobs resource. See (http://goo.gl/BVcXk4) for a full list of supported values.
Load data from a file in your Cloud Storage bucket.
Load data from multiple files in your Cloud Storage bucket(s).
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: source
params.description: • The source file to import.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • Metadata to set with the load operation. The metadata object should be in the format of the configuration.load property of a Jobs resource.

params.name: metadata.format
params.description: • The format the data being imported is in. Allowed options are "CSV", "JSON", or "AVRO".

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.job
params.description: • The job used to import your data.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

exceptions.description: If the source isn't a string file name or a File instance.

methods.name: insert
methods.description:
Stream data into BigQuery one record at a time without running a load job.

There are more strict quota limits using this method so it is highly recommended that you load data into BigQuery using bigquery/table#import instead.

examples.caption: Insert a single row.
Insert multiple rows at a time.
Insert a row as according to the specification.
Handling the response. See Troubleshooting Errors for best practices on how to handle errors.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: rows
params.description: • The rows to insert into the table.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

params.name: options.ignoreUnknownValues
params.description: • Accept rows that contain values that do not match the schema. The unknown values are ignored. Default: false.

params.name: options.raw
params.description: • If true, the rows argument is expected to be formatted as according to the specification.

params.name: options.skipInvalidRows
params.description: • Insert all valid rows of a request, even if invalid rows exist. Default: false.

params.name: options.templateSuffix
params.description: • Treat the destination table as a base template, and insert the rows into an instance table named "{destination}{templateSuffix}". BigQuery will manage creation of the instance table, using the schema of the base template table. See Automatic table creation using template tables for considerations when working with templates tables.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.err.errors
params.description: • If present, these represent partial failures. It's possible for part of your request to be completed successfully, while the other part was not.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • The metadata key/value object to set.

params.name: metadata.description
params.description: • A user-friendly description of the table.

params.name: metadata.name
params.description: • A descriptive name for the table.

params.name: metadata.schema
params.description: • A comma-separated list of name:type pairs. Valid types are "string", "integer", "float", "boolean", "bytes", "record", and "timestamp". If the type is omitted, it is assumed to be "string". Example: "name:string, age:integer". Schemas can also be specified as a JSON array of fields, which allows for nested and repeated fields. See a Table resource for more detailed information.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.
